content:
Hi, I was checking out an issue about persistent caches for RA. In that issue matklad mentioned that RA won't implement persistent cache.
As a user of vim, I was really interested in knowing if there is any existing way or hack to get this feature for vim? If not, should I try to make it myself? I am a total noob with RA's internals at least, so wasn't sure about the difficulty level.
That comment does not refer to persistent caches
implementing persistent caches is very low priority as well, though (but not completely "won't do", I think)
we might need salsa infrastructure for this before it makes sense to look into persistent caches anyways
